section.name: Maven Struts Plug-in
section.p: This document provides an overview of the Maven Struts Plug-in.
The documents presented here are references, if you are looking for more verbose usage material, please refer to the Getting Started section.

subsection.name: What it is
subsection.p: The Struts Plug-in is the place where Struts tools are found in Maven.

At the moment it provides a some useful, simple functionality for developers who use struts as their web application framework of choice. This is in no way a statement by the Maven developers that Struts is the best web application framework for your needs, as Maven is web app framework agnostic, and will be soon providing plug-ins for other frameworks.

subsection.name: Overview of the Struts Plug-in Reference Documentation

tr.td: This document provides detailed information on the various targets that are available as part of the Maven Struts Plug-in. These targets can be delegated to by your project's local build file.
The behavior of the Maven Struts Plug-in can be altered via properties. This document describes each property available as the default used.
The preferred directory layout structure is documented here. This is a useful document if you are trying to determine what a particular component of your directory hierarchy is used for.
These are the current thoughts on additional items that could or should be added to the plug-in. They may or may not make it to an actual task list of a developer.
